title: BIOL322 Lecture 17 - Analysis of variance (ANOVA designs)
section: Learning Goals
text:
Learning Goals


Understand what an ANOVA is
Understand when/how to use an ANOVA
Understand what a F-statistic is and where it comes from
Differentiate between statistical & research conclusions

title: BIOL322 Lecture 17 - Analysis of variance (ANOVA designs)
section: History of ANOVA
text:
History of ANOVA




Invented by Sir R.A. Fisher (“father of modern statistics”)
Used to prove differences between groups to support eugenics & other racist theories









Wikipedia

title: BIOL322 Lecture 17 - Analysis of variance (ANOVA designs)
section: History of ANOVAs
text:
History of ANOVAs




Invented by Sir R.A. Fisher (“father of modern statistics”)
Used to prove differences between groups to support eugenics (among other things)









Wikipedia

title: BIOL322 Lecture 17 - Analysis of variance (ANOVA designs)
section: Types of Variables Used in an ANOVA
text:
Types of Variables Used in an ANOVA


Groups!
We are explaining  continuous  dependent variables using  categorical  independent variables

 continuous  : intelligence (i.e., IQ ranging from 70-130)
 categorical  : race (i.e., white, Black, Indigenous, etc.)

title: BIOL322 Lecture 17 - Analysis of variance (ANOVA designs)
section: When do I use an ANOVA?
text:
When do I use an ANOVA?


You have groups!
We are explaining  continuous  dependent variables using  categorical  independent variables

i.e., if you want to know if there are differences between more than two  groups
